Title: Where the Falcon Flies
Description: A thrilling adventure across the Arctic by one of Canada's most daring explorers
Author: Adam Shoalts

Title: The Kite Runner 20th Anniversary Edition
Description: A special edition of the unforgettable bestseller that launched Khaled Hosseini's career as one of the most acclaimed writers of our time
Author: Khaled Hosseini

Title: The Work of the Future
Description: A comprehensive analysis of the challenges and opportunities posed by the changing nature of work in the twenty-first century
Author: David H. Autor, David A. Mindell and Elisabeth B. Reynolds; foreword by Robert M. Solow

Title: The Fraud
Description: A brilliant and hilarious satire of the art world and the human condition by the Booker Prize-winning author of White Teeth
Author: Zadie Smith

Title: The Daily Laws
Description: A practical guide to mastering the art of power, strategy, and persuasion from the bestselling author of The 48 Laws of Power
Author: Robert Greene

Title: The Girl in the Eagle's Talons
Description: A stunning and suspenseful novel about family secrets, love, and revenge in a remote Swedish village
Author: Karin Smirnoff

Title: Harlem After Midnight
Description: A captivating and atmospheric historical novel set in 1920s New York City, where a young woman becomes entangled in a murder mystery
Author: Louise Hare

Title: The Love Plot
Description: A steamy and swoon-worthy romance between a bestselling author and his editor, who have a complicated history and a shared passion for books
Author: Samantha Young

Title: Hotel Magnifique
Description: A charming and heartwarming story of friendship, family, and finding love in the most unexpected places
Author: Emily J. Taylor

Title: They Called Us Exceptional
Description: A powerful and inspiring memoir of a young woman who escaped poverty and discrimination in India to become a successful journalist and activist in America
Author: Prachi Gupta

Title: Wifedom
Description: A provocative and compelling exploration of the institution of marriage and the role of women in modern society
Author: Anna Funder

Title: Kind of a Big Deal
Description: A witty and insightful look at the cultural impact of comedy legends from Monty Python to Tina Fey
Author: Saul Austerlitz

Title: A Map for the Missing: A Novel
Description: A gripping and emotional story of a young woman's journey to find her missing sister in China.
Author: Belinda Huijuan Tang

Title: So Close: A Blacklist Novel
Description: A thrilling and sexy novel based on the hit TV series The Blacklist, featuring the enigmatic Raymond Reddington and his partner Elizabeth Keen.
Author: Sylvia Day

Title: One of Us Is Back
Description: The highly anticipated sequel to the New York Times bestseller One of Us Is Lying, featuring a new mystery and a new cast of characters.
Author: Karen M. McManus

Title: The Possibilities: A Novel
Description: A moving and uplifting novel about a woman who discovers a new meaning of life after losing her husband and son in a ski accident.
Author: Yael Goldstein-Love

Title: Kala: A Novel
Description: A stunning and epic novel that spans generations and continents, telling the story of a family of Indian immigrants in America and their struggle to find their identity and place in the world.
Author: Colin Walsh

Title: Elizabeth Finch: A novel
Description: A brilliant and captivating novel that reimagines the life of Elizabeth Finch, the first woman to be executed for witchcraft in England.
Author: Julian Barnes

Title: Zero-Sum: Stories
Description: A collection of dark and provocative stories that explore the themes of power, violence, and revenge, from the acclaimed author of We Were the Mulvaneys and Blonde.
Author: Joyce Carol Oates

Title: Astra: A Novel
Description: A dazzling and visionary novel that imagines a near-future where humanity is on the brink of extinction and a young woman must embark on a perilous journey to save the world.
Author: Cedar Bowers

Title: Hide and Seek: A Novel
Description: A suspenseful and twisty novel that follows a mother who is desperate to find her missing daughter, but soon realizes that she is not the only one looking for her.
Author: Andrea Mara

Title: The Economic Government of the World
Description: A comprehensive and authoritative history of the global institutions and organizations that have shaped the world economy since the nineteenth century.
Author: Martin Daunton

Title: Sofreh: A Contemporary Approach to Classic Persian Cuisine: A Cookbook
Description: A stunning and delicious cookbook that showcases the rich and diverse cuisine of Iran, featuring over 100 recipes for soups, salads, stews, rice dishes, breads, desserts, and more.
Author: Nasim Alikhani

Title: Range: Why Generalists Triumph in a Specialized World
Description: A groundbreaking and eye-opening book that challenges the conventional wisdom that the best way to succeed is to focus on a specific field or skill, and shows how having a range of interests and experiences can lead to greater creativity, innovation, and success.
Author: David Epstein

Title: The Forbidden Territory of a Terrifying Woman: A Novel
Description: A thrilling and suspenseful novel about a woman who is hunted by a mysterious group of assassins after she discovers a shocking secret in her past.
Author: Molly Lynch

Title: Nuclear Family: A Novel
Description: A poignant and humorous novel about a Korean American family that struggles to cope with the aftermath of a nuclear accident that affects their lives in unexpected ways.
Author: Joseph Han

Title: In Other Words, Leadership: How a Young Mother's Weekly Letters to Her Governor Helped Both Women Brave the First Pandemic Year
Description: A inspiring and empowering memoir about how a young mother's weekly letters to her governor during the COVID-19 pandemic led to a friendship and a mutual support that helped both women overcome their challenges and find their voices.
Author: Shannon A. Mullen

Title: We've Got This: Unlocking the Beauty of Belonging
Description: A powerful and practical guide to building authentic and inclusive communities that foster a sense of belonging and connection for everyone.
Author: Ritu Bhasin

Title: The Mythmakers: A Novel
Description: A captivating and complex novel about a young woman who becomes entangled in a web of lies and deception when she joins a secretive cult that promises to reveal the truth about her identity and destiny.
Author: Keziah Weir

Title: Knife Drop: Creative Recipes Anyone Can Cook
Description: A fun and easy cookbook that features over 100 delicious and inventive recipes that anyone can make with simple ingredients and a knife.
Author: Nick DiGiovanni

Title: Love, Theoretically
Description: A charming and witty romantic comedy about a physics professor who falls in love with a former student who challenges his rational worldview.
Author: Ali Hazelwood

Title: You Can Trust Me: A Novel
Description: A gripping and twisty psychological thriller about a woman who is hired to spy on her best friend's husband, but soon discovers that nothing is as it seems.
Author: Wendy Heard

Title: The Only One Left
Description: A haunting and suspenseful novel about a woman who returns to her hometown after a decade to investigate the disappearance of her childhood friend, only to find that she may be the next victim.
Author: Riley Sager

Title: If We Break: A Memoir of Marriage, Addiction, and Healing
Description: A raw and honest memoir about a woman who chronicles her journey of healing and recovery after her husband's addiction to opioids nearly destroys their marriage.
Author: Kathleen Buhle

Title: The Mutual Friend: A Novel
Description: A clever and humorous novel about a man who pretends to be friends with a famous author in order to impress his crush, but soon finds himself in a web of lies and complications.
Author: Carter Bays

Title: The Spectacular: A Novel
Description: A dazzling and historical novel about three generations of women who are connected by a secret that spans from the 1940s to the present day.
Author: Fiona Davis
